H0.text: Sperm and egg are the only haploid cells in humans.

H1.text: DNA and egg are the only haploid cells in humans.

H2.text: Sperm and DNA are the only haploid reproductive cells in humans.

H3.text: Uternal and sperm are the only haploid cells in humans.

A4.text: The human sperm cell is haploid, so that its 23 chromosomes can join the 23 chromosomes of the female egg to form a diploid cell with 46 paired chromosomes.

A5.text: During fertilization, the sperm provides three essential parts to the oocyte: (1) a signalling or oocyte-activating factor (OAF), which causes the metabolically dormant oocyte to activate; (2) the haploid paternal genome; (3) the centriole, which is responsible for forming the centrosome and microtubule system.
